moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5: I went with the Scandinavian defence. I did not want to move my queen in the early game and decided to attack the pawn with my knight.
moves.2... Nf6 3. c4: He protects it and opens a way for his queen to move out.
moves.3... c6: I offer my c pawn and he takes it
moves.5. cxb7 Bxb7:
Even tough I am down by two pawns I got a lot of space and developed my white bishop and the king-side knight
Usually I only give up my c pawn and develop my knight. I wanted to try something which is new to me so let's see what is going to happen next.
moves.7... Bd6 8. Ng5 O-O 9. Nc3 Re8:
protecting that pawn, it seemed that my pawn sacrifice at the beginning did not work out as well as I hoped. 
I plan is to get them away from the centre.
moves.10. b3 h6 11. Nh3 Qc7 12. Bb2:
white wisely develops his bishop. We each have a nice diagonal now.
I hesitate and don't know what to do next. The double threat on his h2 pawn comes to mind. I am down to pawns, so why not grab it?
moves.12... Bxh2 13. g3: This looks bad at first but tuns out that he had made a mistake, trying to block my bishop on his way out.
moves.13... Bxg3 14. fxg3 Qxg3+ 15. Nf2 e3: I belive he did not want to move his king and give up the option to castle long. His knight is trapped.
If I would have moved my king to f8 I would have prevented some material loss. 
I just did not see it then ...
moves.21... Nbd7 22. Nd6 Bc6 23. Nf5 Qg5 24. N: Here is the fork. My bishop is lost.
moves.24... Kh8 25. Nxc6 Ng4: I am angry and ready to attack !
moves.26. Rg3 Ndf6: He starts trading. I have to accept since I moved forward a little quickly.
moves.27. Bxf6 Qxf6 28. Rxg4 Qxc6 29. Bg2 Qc8:
Still leading by two points I am happy that I managed to trade equally.

I kept moving all my pawns forward and white resigns when he was loosing his rock which was blocking the f pawn.
I think the start of the game is more interesting. Do you think this kind of opening would work in a regular game??
